headline: Elite Schools Want the Best and Brightest. Current Structure Shows Columbia Has Come to Rely on the Richest, too.

steps: In the last 15 years, it’s no secret that college tuition has risen faster than what the average U.S. family could afford.
But Columbia sets itself apart, growing more expensive at a rate far beyond the average private college.
Both Columbia’s tuition and total cost of attendance is the highest among all Ivy League schools, and are now the most expensive in the nation

body.value: Ivy League schools make money in more than one way. Revenue comes from student tuition, fundraising and donations, revenue from medical centers, government support, and returns that come from the endowment. Columbia sets itself apart in the combination it uses--a much bigger percentage of its operating budget comes from student tuition dollars, as opposed to donations or returns from its endowment.

As the University takes on investments like the multi-billion dollar Manhattanville expansion, tuition dollars, and a steady pool of students who can contribute them, serve as the bedrock to the vision of climbing the ranks among peer institutions.

Now, businesses are shut down, the unemployment rate is at nearly 15 percent, and experts doubt there will be a quick comeback from the pandemic-triggered recession. For many families looking to get back on their feet and come out less vulnerable to future financial fallouts, seeking a college degree becomes priority. History shows that the worst economic times trigger higher college enrollment rates, with low-income populations showing the biggest spikes in enrollment.

In theory, and based on Spectator analysis of Opportunity Insights data, Columbia offers the ideal conditions to support socioeconomic mobility—the University lies in the 98th percentile of colleges where students coming from families in the bottom twenty percent of the U.S. income distribution eventually land in the top twentieth percentile. 2019 data shows that the more selective a school is, the less likely it is to have significantly increased its low-income dependent student population in the last twenty years.
